page.title: 02NABURN INTRODUCTION
page.content: Naburn established as a vale farming settlement and ferry port on the Ouse stands at the limit of tidal naviga- tion,but the economic importance of river freight and cross_river works has diminished and the towpaths are now overgrown. The village acts as a service (dormitory and sewage) and recreaational(boating,yachting,Pub, club,Riding School,Guest House,Caravan Park)adjunct to York,but fortunately has been spared the explosive growth of other satelite villages by building development restraint imposed by the local landowning family at Naburn Hall Most house types since the early C19 are represented here,from original estate workers cottages,Victorian farm houses and vicarage,mid C20 buildings and council housing,to modern small scale estate developments and infill with detached houses and bungalows.
